#Text=( ( A ) )
#Text=Do you mind if I take a photo of yours ?
#Text=( ( ROS ) ) Yeah , by all means !
#Text=Interview with English comic book writer Dan Watters
#Text=Comicbook writer Dan Watters . Image : Agastya .
#Text=Wikinews
#Text=Thank you for agreeing to the interview .
#Text=( ( Agastya ) ) So , would you mind telling us about yourself ?
#Text=( ( Dan Watters ) ) Um , Okay .
#Text=I 'm Dan Watters .
#Text=I am currently writing Lucifer for Vertigo Comics .
#Text=And Deep Roots for Vault Comics .
#Text=I 've done series for Assassin 's Creed , for Wolfenstein .
#Text=Limbo was my first book , at Image Comics .
#Text=( ( A ) )
#Text=How old are you and when did you start writing comics ?
#Text=( ( DW ) ) I am 27 .
#Text=And my first book came out in 2015 .
#Text=So for about three years , I have been doing it professionally .
#Text=( ( A ) ) What drew you into comics , and who was the major influence for you to start writing comics ?

#Text=( ( DW ) ) Oh man ! I originally thought I was gonna get into film-making , but that 's such a slow and arduous process , and sort of relinquish control to so many people because of such a big team and everything , that I sort of fell into comics as something where you , where the writer has a little bit more control , like , directly .
#Text=Major influence-wise , I was a huge fan of old-school Vertigo stuff : say , Sandman , Lucifer , Swamp Thing , Doom Patrol : those were the books that really made me want to write .
#Text=( ( A ) ) What was your first job like ?
#Text=( ( DW ) ) My first comics job ? [ ... ]

#Text=Ah , well , Caspar Wijngaard the artist and I pitched Limbo to Image Comics , in-person at a festival , a ComicCon , in the UK called Thought Bubble , and , we got the go ahead , to go away and make that book , but we were brand-new , we had no idea of what we were doing .
#Text=And we entirely had to essentially work , or feel our way through .
#Text=So we were n't doing a book that had an editor , or had other people in charge .

#Text=It was just the two of us making this book , which was just amazing and terrifying , but such a sort of trial by fire as far as these things go so there 's no one to tell us how to do things things , but it was great , I mean , really happy how the book came out .
#Text=( ( A ) ) How has the times changed since then ?

#Text=( ( DW ) ) Well , now I am working with a , because I have done a lot of work stuff on licensed works , doing stuff which is other people 's properties : so be it big franchises , like Assassin 's Creed and Wolfenstein where it 's very well established things that you have to sort of , you know , there 's certain fan expectations in that and things that you need to , things you need to have .
#Text=To something like Lucifer which I am doing now , which is a spin-off of Sandman , so it 's Neil Gaiman worlds , that I 'm writing .

#Text=And so it 's a big difference between writing from something that 's entirely your own and you can do anything with it ; and writing something that 's someone else 's that has the weight of history , you know , has a weight of series history behind it .
#Text=But , I enjoy all of it .
